title: Calories in 2 Scrambled Eggs
meta_description: Discover calories in 2 scrambled eggs, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Large eggs (~50 g each), scrambled with 1 tsp butter total, no milk, cheese, or added salt.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, cooking fat amount, added ingredients, and method. Check labels or recipes when available.

quick_answer.text: Two large scrambled eggs provide ~182 kcal and ~13 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use oil instead of butter (1 tsp total)

faqs.q: How many calories in one scrambled egg?
faqs.a: About 91 kcal for one large scrambled egg with minimal butter.

faqs.q: What is the protein in 2 scrambled eggs?
Do scrambled eggs have a lot of fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 13.4 g total fat for two, mostly from the eggs and cooking butter.

faqs.q: How does adding milk affect calories in scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: Adding 1 tbsp milk per egg increases calories by ~10 kcal per egg.

faqs.q: Are scrambled eggs high in cholesterol?
faqs.a: Two scrambled eggs contain ~400 mg cholesterol, mainly from the yolks.
